snippet: Tying federal student loan rates to Treasury rates would make them more stable and less arbitrary.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Sens Lamar Alexander, Tom Coburn and Richard Burr outlines their proposal to change arbitrary way interest rates are determined on federal student loans; holds tying such loan rates to Treasury rates would make them more stable; fears Senate Democrats may oppose a permanent solution and extend existing, arbitrary rate for some loans for two years.

byline.original: By LAMAR ALEXANDER, TOM COBURN and RICHARD BURR

lead_paragraph: Tying federal student loan rates to Treasury rates would make them more stable and less arbitrary.

headline.seo: Stop Playing Politics With College Loans
